Do: Create StatelessWidget for UI that doesn't change over time
Don't: Make everything a StatefulWidget
Flutter Example: class MyCard extends StatelessWidget { @override Widget build(BuildContext context) => const Card(); }

Do: Mark immutable widgets const for compile-time optimization
Don't: Leave out const for literal widgets

Do: Extract sub-widgets into separate Widget methods or classes when build() > 50 lines
Don't: Write 200+ line build methods

Do: Use SizedBox(height: 16) or SizedBox(width: 8) between widgets
Don't: Use Container with just padding for spacing

Do: Call setState inside callbacks, event handlers, or initState
Don't: Invoke setState within build()

Do: Use Riverpod providers for state shared across multiple widgets
Don't: Pass state down many widget layers via constructor

Do: Always dispose AnimationController in dispose() method
Don't: Let AnimationControllers live beyond their widget lifetime

Do: Check if mounted before using setState or context after an await
Don't: Use BuildContext after async without mounted check

Do: Switch layouts based on constraints.maxWidth
Don't: Use fixed pixel sizes for responsive UIs

Do: Use Expanded to fill remaining space, Flexible to take proportional space
Don't: Forget flex children inside Row/Column causing overflow

Do: Use Wrap, Flow, or custom layout when nesting gets deep
Don't: Nest 4+ levels of Row/Column without extracting widgets

Do: Wrap main content with SafeArea to avoid status bar / notch overlap
Don't: Render content under system UI without SafeArea

Do: Build list items lazily with ListView.builder
Don't: Use ListView(children: [...]) for long or dynamic lists

Do: Build grid items lazily in GridView.builder
Don't: Use GridView.count() for large datasets

Do: Use CustomScrollView with SliverList when mixing scrollable elements
Don't: Use nested ListViews (causes layout issues)

Do: Use GoRouter for type-safe named routes and deep linking
Don't: Rely solely on Navigator.push without named routes

Do: Use PopScope for Android predictive back gesture
Don't: Ignore back navigation handling

Do: Pass minimal primitive data between routes; load details in destination
Don't: Pass entire model objects through Navigator arguments
Flutter Example: GoRouter path parameters or Uri query params only

Do: Always use Theme.of(context).colorScheme.primary
Don't: Use const Color(0xFFXXXXXX) directly in widgets

Do: Always provide darkTheme in MaterialApp
Don't: Only provide theme without darkTheme

Do: Set useMaterial3: true in ThemeData
Don't: Use deprecated Material 2 component styles

Do: Use theme.textTheme.headlineLarge etc for all text styles
Don't: Hardcode fontSize/fontWeight/letterSpacing in widgets

Do: Define custom design tokens via ThemeExtension
Don't: Add random properties to ThemeData or pass colors as parameters

Do: Use AnimatedContainer for property changes over time
Don't: Use explicit AnimationController for simple property animations

Guideline: Use Hero for shared element transitions
Do: Wrap shared elements with Hero widget and same tag
Don't: Use custom PageRoute without Hero for shared element transitions

Do: Use 200-300ms for most transitions, 400ms max for complex ones
Don't: Use 1000ms+ animations for routine UI transitions

Do: Apply Curves.easeInOut for natural motion
Don't: Use Curves.linear for all animations (feels mechanical)

Do: Wrap frequently-animating widgets in RepaintBoundary
Don't: Let animations trigger full-tree repaints

Do: Use cached_network_image package for all network images
Don't: Use Image.network() without caching in production

Do: Move heavy computations (sorting, filtering) outside build() into state
Don't: Run expensive computations directly in build() method

Do: Load data only when needed; paginate long lists
Don't: Load all data upfront for potentially long datasets
Flutter Example: _page++ when user approaches end of list

Do: Use Consumer/Selector for fine-grained Riverpod/Provider updates
Don't: Call ref.watch on large providers when only accessing a tiny part

Do: Use semanticsLabel on Image.network/asset or Semantics wrapper
Don't: Leave decorative images for screen readers without excludeFromSemantics

Do: Add tooltip or Semantics(label:) to icon buttons and custom tappables
Don't: Use bare GestureDetector without semantic label

Do: Test with large font sizes; use MediaQuery.textScalerOf
Don't: Hardcode text heights that break with large system font sizes

Do: Test all text on backgrounds for WCAG AA contrast
Don't: Use grey on light grey or vice versa

Do: Use FocusTraversalGroup for predictable Tab focus on web/desktop
Don't: Leave focus order to chance on web/desktop targets

Do: Validate inputs in Form widget with GlobalKey<FormState>
Don't: Show errors only after failed API calls

Do: Show errors immediately after field blur or on form submit
Don't: Show errors only in a SnackBar or dialog

Do: Use resizeToAvoidBottomInset: true in Scaffold
Don't: Let keyboard overlap input fields

Do: Use obscureText: true for password fields with show/hide toggle
Don't: Show passwords in plain text by default

Do: Use WebP for photos, SVG via flutter_svg for icons, PNG for transparency
Don't: Use JPG for icons or PNG for large photos

Do: Show placeholder while loading, fallback on error
Don't: Show blank space or crash on failed image load

Do: Supply 1x, 2x, 3x assets or use vector SVG
Don't: Use only 1x asset that blurs on Retina/high-DPI screens

Do: Display shimmer or CircularProgressIndicator while loading
Don't: Show empty UI while data is loading

Do: Handle data, loading, and error states in UI
Don't: Only handle the success case
Flutter Example: data: (d) => DataWidget(d), loading: () => Loader(), error: (e,s) => ErrorView(e)

Do: Add 300-500ms debounce to search input
Don't: Call API on every keystroke

Do: Always show a Retry button on error states
Don't: Show error message with no way to recover

Do: Use .adaptive constructors for platform-specific appearance
Don't: Force Material widgets on iOS or Cupertino on Android

Do: Use bottom sheet on iOS, drawer on Android for navigation
Don't: Use the same navigation pattern regardless of platform
